name: Priya Reddy
bio: Priya uses natural dyes and hand-pen techniques to create intricate mythological scenes on cotton fabric, a craft passed down for generations.

name: Gopal Das
bio: Gopal creates vibrant, symbolic paintings using bamboo pens and natural colors, depicting Hindu deities and rural life.

name: Anjali Mehta
bio: Anjali uses hand-carved wooden blocks and organic dyes to print traditional patterns on textiles — a craft rooted in 18th-century Jaipur.

name: Baldev Singh
bio: Baldev’s family has practiced Phulkari for 100+ years. He stitches bright, floral patterns on handwoven shawls using silk thread.

name: Chandra Prakash
bio: Chandra crafts stunning blue-glazed pottery using Persian-inspired techniques, made from quartz, glass, and soda — no clay used.

name: Rekha Nair
bio: Rekha transforms coconut husks into durable mats, ropes, and decorative items — eco-friendly products supporting coastal livelihoods.

name: Manoj Yadav
bio: Manoj creates iconic Bankura horses and deities from red clay, fired in traditional kilns — a craft recognized by UNESCO.

name: Suresh Iyer
bio: Suresh creates gold-leafed, temple-style paintings of gods and goddesses, using semi-precious stones and vibrant natural colors.

name: Nandini Rao
bio: Nandini uses rice paste and bamboo sticks to create tribal Warli art, depicting daily life and nature in minimalist geometric forms.

name: Devender Malik
bio: Devender creates exquisite marble and wood jali (lattice) screens, inspired by Mughal architecture and used in homes and temples.
